questions.question_text: What should you configure to meet the licensing requirements for Admin1?

choices.C: From Settings in the SharePoint admin center, enable Information Rights Management (IRM) for SharePoint Online.
choices.D: Enable an Information Rights Management (IRM) policy for the libraries.
choices.B: For each library, enable sensitivity labeling that uses protection.

questions.question_text:
You need to recommend a solution for the documents stored in the Finance site.
What should you recommend?

discussion.content: I've seen some places say it's A - Azure Information Protection but it's really Information Rights Management. That feature will meet the technical requirements which is to block people from printing. The IRM feature works on both Email and SharePoint and will block users from printing and taking screenshots with Print Screen for example. It however sadly doesn't block people from memorizing content or writing it down or taking photos with their phone or taking screen shots with third party software. Lucky the question is just focused on easy basic stuff and not on all that technical stuff so just go with IRM for this one and you'll be set

choices.B: From the SharePoint team site, modify the Members group
choices.A: From the SharePoint team site, modify the Visitors group.
choices.C: From Microsoft Outlook, add a member to a group.

questions.question_text:
You need to meet the technical requirements for the finance department site collection.
What should you do?

choices.D: From the SharePoint Admin center, select Sharing, and then select Limit external sharing using domains.
choices.B: From the Security & Compliance admin center, create a classification label policy.
choices.A: From the SharePoint admin center, select the finance department site collection, and then configure the Sharing settings.
choices.C: From the Security & Compliance admin center, create a permission policy.
